Introduction

The BIOTICA R package provides statistical tools for ecosystem resilience assessment.

Installation

```{r eval=FALSE}
install.packages("biotica", repos = NULL, type = "source")
library(biotica)
```

Basic Usage

IBR Computation

```{r}
params <- list(
  VCA = 0.85,
  MDI = 0.78,
  PTS = 0.82
)
result <- ibr_composite(params)
print(result)
```

Tipping Point Detection

```{r}
set.seed(42)
ts <- cumsum(rnorm(200))
tipping <- tipping_points(ts, window = 30)
print(tipping)
```

Advanced Examples

Batch Processing Multiple Plots

```{r}
# Create sample data
plots <- data.frame(
  plot_id = 1:5,
  VCA = runif(5, 0.6, 0.9),
  MDI = runif(5, 0.6, 0.9),
  PTS = runif(5, 0.6, 0.9)
)

# Compute IBR for each plot
results <- apply(plots[,2:4], 1, function(x) {
  ibr_composite(as.list(x))
})

# Extract scores
scores <- sapply(results, function(x) x$score)
print(scores)
```
